root.p:
Eré tí ọ̀pọ̀lọ́ ńsá nínú omi gbígbóná, tó bá sáa lọ́dàn ni, kò ní wọ omi gbígbóná
Had the frog been as fleet-footed in the fields as it is in the hot water pot, it won't have entered the pot.

O bẹ́fọ̀n lábàtà, o yọ̀bẹ tìí, ṣómi lo rò pó mu kú ni?
You pulled your knife on a dead buffalo at the river bank; did you think it drowned?

Tí omi ẹni ò bá tí ì tóni wẹ̀ á máa fi ńbọ́jú ni.
If the amount of water one has won't do for a bath, one should use it to wash the face

Ọwọ́ ọmọdé ò tó pẹpẹ, tàgbàlagbà ò wọ akèrègbè
A child's hand can't reach the shelf as an elder's can't enter a gourd

Mímì lẹpọ̀n àgbò ńmì, kò lè já.
The ram's testicles are merely dangling, they cannot fall off

Tí nbá ní iná ńjó lórí omi, wàá ní ki ńkó eérú rẹ̀ wá.
If I claim fire is burning on water, ask me for the ashes

Nínú oore loore wà.
Kindness begets kindness.
